description: Borrowed from Late Latin meliorāre, a verb based on Latin melior (“better”).

verbs.description: meliorate (third-person singular simple present meliorates, present participle meliorating, simple past and past participle meliorated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make better; to improve; to solve a problem.
examples: They offered some compromises in an effort to meliorate the disagreement.
